metadata.Title: CVE-2020-27792 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A heap-based buffer over write vulnerability was found in GhostScript's lp8000_print_page() function in gdevlp8k.c file. An attacker could trick a user to open a crafted PDF file, triggering the heap buffer overflow that could lead to memory corruption or a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27792` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5
ghostscript-x - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5
libgs9 - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5
libgs9-common - 9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.55.0~dfsg1-0ubuntu5').
